headline.main: SHIPPING AND MAILS; DAYLIGHT SAVING TIME

docs.snippet: All plans were completed at the World's Fair yesterday for the arrival today of Secretary of State Cordell Hull, who, as honor guest at the Pan-American Day exercises, will deliver a speech in the Court of Peace at 3:30 P.M. According to the...
docs.lead_paragraph: All plans were completed at the World's Fair yesterday for the arrival today of Secretary of State Cordell Hull, who, as honor guest at the Pan-American Day exercises, will deliver a speech in the Court of Peace at 3:30 P.M. According to the Pan-American Union, sponsor of the event, the address is expected to strike the keynote for American policy toward Latin America in view of the war situation abroad.
docs.abstract: N Y World's Fair event illus

headline.main: HULL AT FAIR TODAY TO GIVE LATIN AIMS; Talk Is Timed to Hit Keynote for U.S. Policy, According to Pan American Union ATTENDANCE SLOW AGAIN Swing Mardi Gras Today Will Launch Drive to Revive It --Hughes Is a Visitor

headline.main: AMERICAS TO GUARD SAFETY, SAYS HULL; Each of 21 Republics Set to Defend Itself Against Any Threat, He Asserts at Fair

docs.snippet: A reception and dinner were given last night in the National Advisory Committees Building at the World's Fair for the official party of the Pan American Union, which celebrated Pan-American Day at the Fair yesterday.
docs.lead_paragraph: A reception and dinner were given last night in the National Advisory Committees Building at the World's Fair for the official party of the Pan American Union, which celebrated Pan-American Day at the Fair yesterday.

headline.main: FAIR DINNER MARKS PAN-AMERICAN DAY; H.E. Manvilles, Thomas J. Watsons, J.S. Carsons and Harry Kings Among Hosts RECEPTION ALSO IS GIVEN Events for Official Party Are Held in National Advisory Committees Building

docs.snippet: KOENIGSBERG, Germany, Sept. 23--A night's undisturbed slumber having quieted their nerves, frayed in the three-week German bombing and bombardment of Warsaw, the 1,400 neutral refugees who arrived here from Warsaw yesterday and are quartered in...
docs.lead_paragraph: KOENIGSBERG, Germany, Sept. 23--A night's undisturbed slumber having quieted their nerves, frayed in the three-week German bombing and bombardment of Warsaw, the 1,400 neutral refugees who arrived here from Warsaw yesterday and are quartered in Koenigsberg and its suburbs began today to take a new lease on life.
docs.abstract: Warsaw neutrals flee to Koenigsberg, Germany

headline.main: WARSAW NEUTRALS ESCAPE FROM CITY; 1,400 Are Now in Koenigsberg After Trip Through German Lines Under Escort 50 AMERICANS IN GROUP Their Future Is a Puzzle Since Many Have Lost All Their Possessions in Bombings

byline.original: By C. BROOKS PETERS Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: PANAMA, Sept. 23--The world's attention was called to the fact that twenty-one Pan-American Foreign Ministers are assembled here with no thought to "destroy, enslave or dismember any nation," and with no secret treaties to negotiate, by President...
docs.lead_paragraph: PANAMA, Sept. 23--The world's attention was called to the fact that twenty-one Pan-American Foreign Ministers are assembled here with no thought to "destroy, enslave or dismember any nation," and with no secret treaties to negotiate, by President Juan Demostenes Arosemena of Panama in welcoming the delegations at the formal opening of the neutrality consultations here late today.

headline.main: NAZI AIMS DECRIED AT PANAMA SESSION; Arosemena Urges Americas to Keep Clear of War as Aid in Serving Humanity WOMEN OF LONDON ANSWER THE CALL FOR FIRE-FIGHTERS
